group_1.narration: We must be studious, so as not to@dishonor the heritage of the Mizuna Ward.
At the time, I was beset by this mindset in@the form of an onslaught of club activities@and training, which corroded my body and spirit.

group_1.textLeft: Is it safe to assume you've improved?

group_1.textRight: Yes, you may expect great results at the@upcoming recital...

group_1.textLeft: Then that is exactly what I will expect.
You are my precious granddaughter after all.
Now then, put your things away and come@into the kitchen.
It's time to test your retention and see if@you can cook what I taught you yesterday.

group_1.textRight: May I please have a short rest?

group_1.textLeft: What makes you believe you should get one,@young lady?
Things were nowhere near this easy when@I was your age.
You may think I'm hard on you, but this is @me being lenient, you know.
Now we will have dinner. Once you're@finished, we'llâ€”

group_1.textRight: Mother, she's done so much already...
Tsukuyo can't take much more of this...

group_1.textLeft: You gave up on your training. You have no@right to an opinion on the matter.
Tsukuyo won't be seduced by some wild@child like you.
I cannot allow her to follow in your@footsteps.
Mother, please don't worry about me...@

group_1.narration: Nothing but training, day in and day out...
Always doing what I was told,@I began to forget who I was.
Whenever I felt like I was losing myself,@there was one thing that gave me solace...
The flute said to have been given@to me by my father in my infancy.
My dear grandmother would become angry when@she saw it, so I had to keep it well hidden.
Its resonance was the only oasis I had in @those days, the few times I had a chance @to play it.
